intro: Spilanthes vazhachalensis, commonly known as Vazhachal mountain dandelion, is a flowering plant native to the Western Ghats of India. It belongs to the genus Spilanthes, which is part of the family Asteraceae, commonly known as the sunflower family. The plant is characterized by its yellowish-white flowers and is often found in rocky or mountainous terrain. It has a short stature and is adapted to thrive in humid, subtropical climates. Due to its unique habitat and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
